alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 3:47AM CDT until June 29 at 4:45AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Smith County in north central Kansas... Northeastern Phillips County in north central Kansas... Franklin County in south central Nebraska... Southeastern Harlan County in south central Nebraska... * Until 445 AM CDT. * At 345 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Orleans, or 24 miles north of Phillipsburg, moving east at 40 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR Alma, Huntley, Republican City, Franklin, and Riverton. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Alma around 355 AM CDT. Republican City and Harlan County Dam around 405 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Naponee, Bloomington. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. This is a dangerous storm, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck.
